Enabling Barbican in previous versions of Barbican was added in and is not available in 2.x distributions. (Details of the Barbican Key Management Service are discussed in .)
For upgrades to :
If you had already added Barbican in your deployment, then no action is required.
However, if the Barbican service is not installed in your existing installation, follow the process outlined here to add Barbican after you have upgraded your cloud to .
If you are upgrading to with your existing input model configuration files, you will have to include Barbican sections in the relevant input model files after performing the upgrade.

There are three service components (barbican-api, barbican-client, barbican-worker) that need to be included in the service-components list. These service-components are provided in the control plane configuration file, control_plane.yml at ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml. These three Barbican components need to be defined for clusters that have a server-role of 'CONTROLLER-ROLE' or 'CORE-ROLE' in their control plane definitions. Here is an example of the three Barbican components added to control_plane.yml under CONTROLLER-ROLE: control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 ... ... clusters: - name: cluster1 ... ... cluster-prefix: c1 server-role: CONTROLLER-ROLE ... ... service-components: - lifecycle-manager - ntp-server ... ... - barbican-api - barbican-client - barbican-worker ... ...
... ...
After making the changes, you must run site.yml:

TLS configuration In internal and admin VIP endpoints can be secured behind TLS. In addition, TLS support was extended in to the Barbican API node/host. Therefore, you will need to make changes in existing input model files to add TLS for Barbican traffic beyond the internal load balancer. You must enable TLS for Barbican on the load balancer back end and service endpoint by adding barbican-api to the tls-component-endpoints: section of network_groups.yml, as shown next.

Go to helion/my_cloud/definition/data/ and edit network_groups.yml>cd ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/ ....... ..... tags: - neutron.networks.vxlan - neutron.networks.vlan: provider-physical-network: physnet1 - nova.compute.iscsi
tls-component-endpoints: - barbican-api component-endpoints: - default
routes: - default load-balancers: - provider: ip-cluster load-balancers: - provider: ip-cluster name: lb tls-components: - default components: - vertica - rabbitmq - mysql - nova-metadata roles: - internal - admin cert-file: helion-internal-cert Commit the changes cd ~/helion git add -A git commit -m "My config" Then run the following Ansible playbooks: $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml -e encrypt="" -e rekey="" $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml $ cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts barbican-reconfigure.yml $ ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts hlm-reconfigure.yml
